page.title: 17ATTITUDES
page.content: In a survey of residents of Westlands, only a minority were content with the amenities on the estate. A significant number were critical at the lack of general services. Highest on the list was the lack of playing space for children and general youth facilities on the estate. Criticism was expressed at the lack of medical and banking facilities and poor shopping. There was a general concern at the lack of 'civic' pride and the general untidiness and appearance of the area. Roaming dogs featured high on the list of complaints. Some residents were unhappy about the high density of the development, the lack of privacy that ensues and the problem of noisy neighbours. This was generally blamed on the poor soundproofing qualities of the houses. An improved bus service into Droitwich was also called for.
